001
002package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.node;
003
004import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.format.IPathFormatter;
005import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.model.IAssemblyInstance;
006import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.qname.IEnhancedQName;
007import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util.ObjectUtils;
008
009import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
010
011/**
012 * A marker interface used to expose root node functionality for an assembly
013 * node that has root information.
014 */
015public interface IRootAssemblyNodeItem extends IAssemblyNodeItem, IFeatureChildNodeItem {
016
017  /**
018   * Get the name of this node.
019   * <p>
020   * This overrides the default behavior using the root name for the assembly.
021   */
022  @Override
023  default IEnhancedQName getQName() {
024    return ObjectUtils.requireNonNull(getDefinition().getRootQName());
025  }
026
027  /**
028   * Get the parent document node item for this root.
029   *
030   * @return the parent document item
031   */
032  @NonNull
033  IDocumentNodeItem getDocumentNodeItem();
034
035  @Override
036  @NonNull
037  default IDocumentNodeItem getParentNodeItem() {
038    return getDocumentNodeItem();
039  }
040
041  @Override
042  default IAssemblyNodeItem getParentContentNodeItem() {
043    // there is no assembly parent
044    return null;
045  }
046
047  @Override
048  default IAssemblyInstance getInstance() {
049    // there is no instance
050    return null;
051  }
052
053  @Override
054  default IRootAssemblyNodeItem getNodeItem() {
055    return this;
056  }
057
058  @Override
059  default int getPosition() {
060    // a root is always in the first position
061    return 1;
062  }
063
064  @Override
065  default String format(@NonNull IPathFormatter formatter) {
066    return formatter.formatRootAssembly(this);
067  }
068}
